026package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.operators;
027
028import java.util.List;
029import java.util.logging.Logger;
030import java.util.regex.Matcher;
031import java.util.regex.Pattern;
032
033import com.ibm.streams.operator.Attribute;
034import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext;
035import com.ibm.streams.operator.OutputTuple;
036import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingInput;
037import com.ibm.streams.operator.Tuple;
038import com.ibm.streams.operator.Type.MetaType;
039import com.ibm.streams.operator.logging.TraceLevel;
040import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.InputPortSet;
041import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.InputPorts;
042import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.Parameter;
043import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.PrimitiveOperator;
044import com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns.TupleInTupleOut;
045
046/**
047 * Sample operator that using regular expressions to filter tuples. This class
048 * extends the pattern class {@code TupleInTupleOut} to implement a functor
049 * like behavior when a tuple is output if it matches any regular expression.
050 * <P>
051 * A set of regular expression patterns is set by the parameter
052 * {@code patterns}. The operator uses the matching capability provided by
053 * the standard Java package {@code java.util.regex}.
054 * </P>
055 * <P>
056 * A tuple matches if any of its {@code ustring} attributes match any of
057 * the provided patterns. If a tuple matches then an output tuple will be
058 * generated with its attributes set from the input using
059 * {@link OutputTuple#assign(Tuple)}.
060 * </P>
061 * <P>
062 * This operator provided as the sample Java primitive operator
063 * <BR>
064 * {@code com.ibm.streams.javaprimitivesamples.operators.RegexFilter}
065 * <BR>
066 * in the sample {@code JavaOperators} toolkit located in:
067 * <BR>
068 * {@code $STREAMS_INSTALL/samples/spl/feature/JavaOperators}
069 * </P>
070 * 
071 * @see java.util.regex.Pattern
072 * @see OutputTuple#assign(Tuple)
073 */
074@PrimitiveOperator(name="RegexFilter",
075        description="Sample operator that using regular expressions to filter tuples.",
076        comment=Regex.IBM_Teracloud_ApS_COPYRIGHT)
077@InputPorts(@InputPortSet(cardinality=1))
078public class Regex extends TupleInTupleOut {
079    
080    /**
081     * SPL Trace facility
082     */
083    private final static Logger trace = Logger.getLogger(Regex.class.getName());
084
085
086    private Pattern[] compiledPatterns;
087    private Matcher[] matchers;
088
089    /**
090     * {@inheritDoc}
091     */
092    public void initialize(OperatorContext context)
093            throws Exception {
094        super.initialize(context);
095    }
096    
097    /**
098     * Set the patterns used to filter tuples.
099     * The parameter {@code patterns} sets the regular expressions to match the
100     * incoming tuple against.
101     * 
102     * @param patterns Regular expression patterns to be used to filter tuples.
103     */
104    @Parameter(description="Set the regular expression patterns used to filter tuples.")
105    public synchronized void setPatterns(List<String> patterns) {
106        
107        trace.log(TraceLevel.DEBUG, "patterns=" + patterns);
108
109        // Compile the patterns and create a Matcher per pattern.
110        // The matcher will be reset for each value to be matched in filter.
111        compiledPatterns = new Pattern[patterns.size()];
112        matchers = new Matcher[patterns.size()];
113        for (int i = 0; i < compiledPatterns.length; i++) {
114            compiledPatterns[i] = Pattern.compile(patterns.get(i));
115            matchers[i] = compiledPatterns[i].matcher("");
116        }
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * Execute the regular expressions against any <code>ustring</code>
121     * in the incoming tuple. If any match exists true is returned
122     * to indicate an outgoing tuple is to be sent using the
123     * <code>transform</code> method.
124     */
125    @Override
126    protected boolean filter(StreamingInput<Tuple> inputStream, Tuple tuple) {
127
128        for (Attribute attr : inputStream.getStreamSchema()) {
129            if (attr.getType().getMetaType() != MetaType.USTRING)
130                continue;
131
132            String value = tuple.getString(attr.getName());
133
134            for (Matcher matcher : getMatchers()) {
135                if (matcher.reset(value).matches()) {
136                    return true;
137                }
138            }
139
140        }
141        return false;
142    }
143
144    /**
145     * Get the list of Matchers compiled from the patterns.
146     * Synchronized to ensure that all threads are guaranteed
147     * visibility to the correct value set by the synchronized
148     * method initialize.
149         * @return the matchers
150         */
151        private synchronized Matcher[] getMatchers() {
152                return matchers;
153        }
154
155        /**
156     * Simply assign the input tuple to the output tuple which will copy across
157     * the values for any matching Attributes, regardless of position in the
158     * StreamSchema.
159     */
160    @Override
161    protected boolean transform(StreamingInput<Tuple> inputStream, Tuple tuple,
162            OutputTuple outTuple) throws Exception {
163
164        outTuple.assign(tuple);
165        return true;
166    }
167}
